newsitem.title: UK: UK grain futures down on currency, end off lows.
newsitem.headline: UK grain futures down on currency, end off lows.

text.p: A strong pound sterling against other European currencies put UK grain futures under pressure again on Friday with wheat as much as 1.55 stg down during the morning session.
However, during the afternoon values rallied to finished 0.70 to one stg lower after trading 481 lots.
Barley closed 0.55 stg down after trading 10 lots.
In Amsterdam the milling wheat futures contract was again neglected.
Lower futures again proved to be good news for the UK delivered market with traders reporting an active morning, but a quiet afternoon as the futures rallied.
Nearby feed wheat was fetching 97 stg in East Anglia while material for delivery in the New Year was trading at 99 stg a tonne.
In the Avon area 96 stg was paid for Nov and 99.50 stg for Jan/Mar delivery.
On the fob market only one trade was reported when May fetched 100 stg a tonne ex-east coast ports.
